page.title: 07Agriculture in North Yorks
page.content: Agriculture is the main occupation in the area,either working in farming or farming related industries. In recent years there has been a decline in the number of small holdings in favour of the larger farms. This may be due to the unwillingness of land owners to rent out fields & some families have had to sell land for financial reasons. Around Cropton,the{Forestry {Commision}farms huge areas of forest & this is a source of employment outside the area. Animal farming is the main enterprise although the larger farms concentrate on cereals,potatoes & other cash crops. The smaller farmer works on livestock rearing,some relying heavily on grants available for hill sheep & cattle. Mechanical farming,modern fertilisers & new high yield crops have made great changes to the traditional farm.
